thread.title: Hamas calls stabbing attack against Israelis “new Intifada” | Politics
thread.title_full: Hamas calls stabbing attack against Israelis “new Intifada” | Politics

author: beforeitsnews.com
title: Hamas calls stabbing attack against Israelis “new Intifada” | Politics
text:
(Before It's News)
Hamas calls stabbing attack against Israelis “new Intifada” – YouTube
A Palestinian has been killed and dozens of others injured in the latest wave of violence in the occupied territories.
Protests are right now being held across the occupied West Bank over Israeli forces and settlers’ provocations in the al-Aqsa Mosque. A Palestinian youth was injured after an Israeli military vehicle ran over him in Beit El settlement near the city of Ramallah. Several protesters have also been arrested. Earlier, four stabbing attacks in the occupied territories left one Palestinian dead and six others injured. Several Israelis have also been wounded. The Palestinian Resistance Movement Hamas has called stabbing attacks against Israelis a new intifada or uprising. Ismail Haniyeh stressed that intifada is the only path that will lead to liberation. He also said Gaza is more than ready for confrontation. At least 8 Palestinians including 8 children have been killed by Israeli forces since the beginning of October. Over the past two months, Israel has intermittently prevented the entry of Muslims into the al-Aqsa Mosque compound during visits by Israeli settlers and officials.
Israeli forces shoot dead several Palestinians in Gaza Strip
A Palestinian has been killed and dozens of others injured in the latest wave of violence in the occupied territories.
Protests are right now being held across the occupied West Bank over Israeli forces and settlers’ provocations in the al-Aqsa Mosque. A Palestinian youth was injured after an Israeli military vehicle ran over him in Beit El settlement near the city of Ramallah. Several protesters have also been arrested. Earlier, four stabbing attacks in the occupied territories left one Palestinian dead and six others injured. Several Israelis have also been wounded. The Palestinian Resistance Movement Hamas has called stabbing attacks against Israelis a new intifada or uprising.
Palestinian shot dead near al-Khalil after stabbing Israeli police
More stabbings in the occupied Palestinian territories .A Palestinian man has been shot dead after stabbing an Israeli police officer at the entrance to the Kiryat Arba settlement near the city of Hebron al-Khalil. The Israeli officer was lightly injured in the incident. In Jerusalem al-Quds, Israeli forces shot and injured a Palestinian man after he stabbed an Israeli teenager. Earlier, an Israeli settler wounded several Palestinians in the city of Dimona. The Israeli assailant first stabbed a 35-year-old Bedouin laborer and then attacked three other Palestinian workers as he was fleeing the scene. Palestinians are growingly angry at Israel over Tel Aviv’s continued crackdown on people in the occupied West Bank. The territory has been the scene of numerous protests over the desecration of al-Aqsa mosque by Israeli troops and settlers.
Israeli settler stabs 4 Palestinians in Dimona
An Israeli settler has stabbed and injured several Palestinians in the occupied territories. The incident took place outside a school in the city of Dimona. The Israeli assailant first stabbed a 35-year-old Bedouin laborer and then attacked three other Palestinian workers as he was fleeing the scene. The attack comes amid the flare-up in tensions between the Israeli regime and Palestinians. The occupied territories have been the scene of similar incidents over the past several days. On Thursday, violent clashes erupted across the Palestinian lands for the seventh consecutive day. Palestinian Health Ministry says at least seven Palestinians including a child have been killed by Israeli forces since the beginning of October. It also said more than 750 others have been injured by the Israeli army.
Funeral held for Palestinian teen killed by Israeli forces
The funeral in the city of Ramallah turned into an anti-Israeli demonstration. The protesters condemned recent Israeli crimes in the occupied territories. 19-year-old Mohannad had reportedly injured several Israeli settlers before he was gunned down. Two of the settlers died of their wounds shortly afterwards.
